thread.title_full: BASEBALL: Former Herald All-Scholastic Mac Curran transfers from Niagara to Bridgeport | High School Insider | with Danny Ventura & Jim Clark | Boston Herald

author: Dan Ventura
title: BASEBALL: Former Herald All-Scholastic Mac Curran transfers from Niagara to Bridgeport | High School Insider | with Danny Ventura & Jim Clark
text:
Two-time Boston Herald All-Scholastic pitcher Mac Curran of Coyle-Cassidy has transferred from Niagara to Bridgeport, where he will have three years of eligibility remaining.
 Curran appeared in 11 games for the Purple Eagles last year, 10 of them in a relief capacity. He is expected to be used as a starter for the Purple Knights.
 One of the most dominant left-handed pitchers in the state while at Coyle-Cassidy (2010-13), the 6-foot-5, 253-pounder posted a career record of 23-5 with an ERA of 0.63.
 Curran spent last summer with the Martha's Vineyard Sharks of the Futures League. He was 1-1 and struck out 30 batters in 28 innings.
